Issues.Title: [draft] Add 'fill mode' to NgOptimizedImage
Issues.Body:
This PR creates a new boolean attribute on the ngOptimizedImage directive called `fill`, which allows the directive to be used without height and width, and which automatically styles the image to fill it's containing element.

This PR still requires some additional test cases before merging. Posting now for feedback from @AndrewKushnir and @pkozlowski-opensource. CC: @kara
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[draft] Add 'fill mode' to NgOptimizedImage" (#47727)

Issues.Title: fix(core): pad error codes up to 4 digits
Issues.Body:
Add leading 0 in error codes optionally. 

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The `formatRuntimeError` method adds a leading zero for error codes that already are 4 digits, resulting in an error URL that does not exist such as:

https://angular.io/errors/NG02200

## What is the new behavior?
The `formatRuntimeError` method pads the absolute code with a leading zero only up to a minimum length of 4. In the preceding example, the URL of the error will become:

https://angular.io/errors/NG2200

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
I have also updated other tests that refer to the wrong functionality.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(core): pad error codes up to 4 digits" (#47720)

Issues.Title: feat(forms): export forms utility functions: isFormArray, isFormGroupâ€¦
Issues.Body:
This commit exports existing utility functions to check for control instances: isFormControl, isFormGroup, isFormRecord, isFormArray Those are useful when implementing validators that use the specifics of one of those control types. To narrow down the type to what it actually is, we can now use the util functions in validators:

```ts
export const myArrayValidator: ValidatorFn = (control) => {
  if (!isFormArray(control)) { return null; }

  // now you can use FormArray-specific members, e.g.:
  if (control.controls.every(c => !!c.value) {
    return { myerror: true }
  } else { return null; }
}
```

Before, this had to be done manually:

```ts
export const myArrayValidator: ValidatorFn = (control) => {
  if (!(control instanceof FormArray)) { return null; }
  // ... 
}
```

Issues.Title: ControlValueAccessor: use types for the function passed to registerOnChange an registerOnTouched instead of any
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

forms

### Description

The parameters of the methods registerOnChange and registerOnTouched of the interface ControlValueAccessor have type any.

IMHO specific types would be better.

### Proposed solution


```
registerOnChange(fn: (arg: any) => void)
registerOnTouched(fn: () => void)
```


This shouldnâ€˜t break existing codeâ€¦

### Alternatives considered

none
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ControlValueAccessor: use types for the function passed to registerOnChange an registerOnTouched instead of any" (#47719)

Issues.Title: Sometimes land on chrome error page for one second when service worker is enabled
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

service-worker

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

This bug was already reported in #43106 but I hope new information will be useful.

First of all: Angular service worker need to be installed and the option "bypass for network" should not be enabled. 

Once done if we go to the app (or reload the page) sometimes we got a chrome error page _Webpage is not reachable_ for one second and after that we got the app.

In the console we see 2 calls : 
- First call to get the page failed: (failed) net:ERR_FAILED.
- Second one succeed from service worker. (There is potentially a call initiated by the service worker but it's not relevant here).

In the service worker console we see 2 things: 
- Warning: The FetchEvent for "https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-devops" resulted in a network error response: the promise was rejected.
- Error: Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Unexpected internal error.

I tried to debug a bit and the issue seems coming from the _sync_ method on those lines: 
`await Promise.all([
          table.write("manifests", manifests),
          table.write("assignments", assignments),
          table.write("latest", latest)
        ]);`

If I surround it with a try/catch and a log I still see the error occuring sometimes but it's perflecty smooth for the user (no chrome error page).



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-devops is having the issue. I can try to setup a small project if needed.

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
In the console :
As a warning:
The FetchEvent for "https://angular.io/guide/service-worker-devops" resulted in a network error response: the promise was rejected.

As an error:
Uncaught (in promise) DOMException: Unexpected internal error.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 13.2.4
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.11.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 13.2.3
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1302.4
@angular-devkit/build-angular   13.2.4
@angular-devkit/core            13.2.4
@angular-devkit/schematics      13.2.4
@angular/cli                    13.2.4
@angular/pwa                    13.2.4
@angular/youtube-player         13.3.8
@schematics/angular             13.2.4
rxjs                            7.5.4
typescript                      4.5.5
```


### Anything else?

When I search about this error it could be an error directly related with Chrome itself:
- https://github.com/GoogleChrome/workbox/issues/792 (I checked my quota and I'm far from it)
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/62512449/uncaught-in-promise-domexception-unexpected-internal-error-from-cache-add

I don't know how the "sync" function is important but it seems to work even with an error (with a try/catch) so maybe there is some  possible work around? Maybe some retries (since it works a few second later) ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Sometimes land on chrome error page for one second when service worker is enabled" (#47715)

Issues.Title: fix(platform-browser): take serialization into account for empty check of transfer state
Issues.Body:
Transfer states with no keys and only serialization callbacks were previously treated as empty which lead to no script getting embedded to transfer the state from the server to the client.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

I am not sure if there is anything in the docs that needs to be updated.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
When no key is present in the transfer state and serialization callbacks are registered, these callbacks are never called as the state is treated as empty and toJson is therefore not called on the server side.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?
Transfer states without keys and serialization callbacks are now treated as non empty which allows them to be send from the server to the client.


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Considering the current behaviour being not very logical and probably not intended I would not consider this change a breaking change.

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(platform-browser): take serialization into account for empty check of transfer state" (#47710)

Issues.Title: installMode and large platforms
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

service-worker

### Description

I don't know if this would be the right place, but I'm reviewing the ngsw-config.json file.
I would like to download all .js(app) files as soon as the user opens the platform, as it improves performance even more when changing routes, but I'm afraid that this will interfere with requests from the frontend to the api.
because our platform is big, it has several angular modules.
We are a Brazilian financial management platform.
Today I use the following configuration:
```
{
    "$schema": "./node_modules/@angular/service-worker/config/schema.json",
    "index": "/index.html",
    "assetGroups": [
        {
            "name": "app",
            "installMode": "lazy",
            "updateMode": "prefetch",
            "resources": {
                "files": ["/favicon.ico", "/index.html", "/manifest.webmanifest", "/*.css", "/*.js"]
            }
        },
        {
            "name": "assets",
            "installMode": "lazy",
            "updateMode": "prefetch",
            "resources": {
                "files": ["/assets/**", "/*.(eot|svg|cur|jpg|png|webp|gif|otf|ttf|woff|woff2|ani)", "!/**/px.gif"],
                "urls": ["fonts.googleapis.com/**", "googletagmanager.com/**", "google-analytics.com/**", "player.vimeo.com/**", "f.vimeocdn.com/**"]
            }
        }
    ]
}

```
would change `installMode` from `lazy` to `prefetch`

### Proposed solution

.

### Alternatives considered

.

Hi there,

currently, the webworker can only be added to an application

in my context, I am using an nx workspace, where every main route is a library.
for one of those I need a webworker to do some big computations (creating clusters for a leaflet map on a big datasource with 45K entries)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add debug profiling support to esbuild angular compiler plugin
Issues.Body: When using the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, initial debug performance profiling information can now be output to the console by using the `NG_BUILD_DEBUG_PERF` environment variable. When enabled, duration information for elements of the Angular build pipeline will be shown on the console. Certain elements marked with an asterisk postfix represent the total parallel execution time and will not correlate directly to the total build time. This information is useful for both experimentation with build process improvements as well as diagnosing slow builds.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add debug profiling support to esbuild angular compiler plugin" (#24043)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): isolate zone.js usage when rendering server bundles
Issues.Body: When generating an app-shell via the app-shell builder, the server application rendering will now take place within a Node.js Worker. Since the rendering requires the presence of Zone.js, this change allows for the Zone.js patching to be isolated from the remainder of the builder and Angular CLI code. This prevents Zone.js from persisting past the needed render operation. This also allows for a workaround to a Zone.js/Node.js v18 problem where the TypeScript dynamic import workaround involving the Function constructor to ensure a native dynamic import expression will cause a failure when running on Node.js v18.10.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): isolate zone.js usage when rendering server bundles" (#24042)

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/bazel-lib</summary>

### [`v1.13.0`](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/tag/v1.13.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/compare/v1.12.1...v1.13.0)

#### Using Bzlmod:

1.  Enable with `--experimental_enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.13.0")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "0154b46f350c7941919eaa30a4f2284a0128ac13c706901a5c768a829af49e11",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.13.0",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/archive/refs/tags/v1.13.0.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:

```starlark

### Register the following toolchain to use jq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_jq_toolchains")

register_jq_toolchains()

### Register the following toolchain to use yq

register_yq_toolchains()
```

-   fix: handle other CPU architectures in local_config_platform by [@​mattem](https://togithub.com/mattem) in [https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/257](https://togithub.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/pull/257)

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/compare/v1.12.1...v1.13.0

Issues.Title: Localization base HREF is not set
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug? localize ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description After adding localization to my app, I read this part of the angular documentation > The CLI also adjusts the HTML base HREF for each version of the application by adding the locale to the configured baseHref. The documentation keeps mentioning that it should happen automatically but I doubt it as adding the locale to my url breaks my router. Meaning, I would expect to also take into account all my current router defined routes. I'm guessing that again - no. ![baseHref](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9778368/194694561-329ab108-b4c8-4402-9e2c-e8b4df075062.png) I am not sure what is wrong and the documentation is not helpful. The localization works btw. It does use the `lv` locale by default now but I want this to be dynamic from the url. Or if not the url, at least I'd like to see it documented on how else this dynamic lang changing can be achieved with Angular. If I can't solve this with native angular, then I will just switch to some other solution which seems counter productive to what angular would want e.g. https://www.freakyjolly.com/switch-multiple-languages-i18n-using-ngx-translate-in-angular-12/ ### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug _No response_ ### Please provide the exception or error you saw ```true No exception. Base HREF is not being set. ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true Angular CLI: 14.2.4 Node: 16.17.0 Package Manager: npm 8.15.0 OS: darwin x64 Angular: 14.2.3 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1402.4 @angular-devkit/build-angular 14.2.4 @angular-devkit/core 14.2.4 @angular-devkit/schematics 14.2.4 @angular/cli 14.2.4 @schematics/angular 14.2.4 rxjs 7.5.7 typescript 4.7.4 ``` ### Anything else? If I add baseHref manually under achitect -> build, then my route does prepend the `en` value. ``` "baseHref": "en", "localize": ["lv"], ``` However, I also added the same baseHref to the locale and angular ignored it. So it seems that the baseHref I mentioned above makes the base href static (?). Not sure. ``` "i18n": { "sourceLocale": "en-US", "locales": { "lv": { "translation": "src/locale/messages.lv.xlf", "baseHref": "lv" } } }, ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Localization base HREF is not set" (#24040)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/schematics): remove `UpdateBuffer` and rename `UpdateBuffer2` to `UpdateBuffer`
Issues.Body:
This PR removes the internally built `UpdateBuffer` and renames `UpdateBuffer2` (based on magic-string) to `UpdateBuffer`. This should have little to no impact for consumers.

BREAKING CHANGE:
The depracated `UpdateBuffer` has been removed and `UpdateBuffer2` is renamed to `UpdateBuffer`. With this change the related and deprecated symbols `ContentCannotBeRemovedException` and `Chunk` have also been removed.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use high resolution time for esbuild builder completion time
Issues.Body: Update the build time calculation for the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder to use the `process.hrtime` time source.  The high resolution time provides a more accurate time source and allows for nanosecond level timings if needed.  Currently the console output is rounded to the nearest millisecond. Future performance monitoring capabilities may leverage the more fine-grained values.

Issues.Title: Auto include `@angular/platform-server/init` and `@angular/localize/init`
Issues.Body:
**feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): auto include `@angular/platform-server/init` during server builds**
    
This changes removes the need to import `@angular/platform-server/init` in the `main.server.ts` instead we now include this as an entry-point when we are bundling as server bundle.

--- 
**feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): auto include `@angular/localize/init` when found in `types`**
    
With this change we remove the need to include the `@angular/localize/init` package as polyfills in `polyfills.ts`, `angular.json` and `main.server.ts`.

Issues.Title: Useless installation of temporary CLI
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I'm not sure if this should be a bug or a feature, it's more of an annoyance.

Every week when I check with 'ng update' it first complains that the CLI is outdated and starts installing a temporary CLI version, which takes a while. Then it tells me there is a new CLI version and I have to install it again with 'ng update @angular/cli', this time for real. Next time I do a 'ng update' it quickly shows me, without the delay.

Is it really necessary to install a new temporary cli version every week ?

Or maybe if there is a new one, can't we have question or a parameter to install the new CLI version (automatically), instead of installing it temporarily (and thus twice)? Just like when you type 'ng new' you also get a question.

### Minimal Reproduction

> ng update

The installed Angular CLI version is outdated.
Installing a temporary Angular CLI versioned 14.2.5 to perform the update.
âˆš Packages successfully installed.

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 14.2.5
Node: 16.16.0
Package Manager: npm 8.3.0
OS: win32 x64
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Useless installation of temporary CLI" (#24024)

Closes #24024

Issues.Title: perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid extra babel file reads in esbuild builder rebuilds
Issues.Body: To further improve incremental rebuild performance of the experimental esbuild-based browser application builder, the output of JS file babel transformations are now cached in memory by the input file name and invalidated via the file watching events. This allows an additional file read per JS input file to be avoided if the file has not changed. Previously the content of the JS input file was used as the basis of the cache key for the transformation output which necessitated reading the file. With the file change information available, the content based method is no longer necessary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid extra babel file reads in esbuild builder rebuilds" (#24018)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): throw more relevant error when Rule returns invalid null value
Issues.Body:
A `null` value is not considered a valid return value for a schematics Rule. Previously, this
would accidently be treated the same as a void return due to incomplete result checking.
However, recent refactoring caused the `null` case to fail with a non-obvious error message when
it should have failed with the existing `InvalidRuleResultException`. Non-tree result objects
including `null` will now fail with `InvalidRuleResultException`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): throw more relevant error when Rule returns invalid null value" (#24016)

Issues.Title: refactor: remove redundant migrations
Issues.Body: This is a bulk delete of old migrations that cannot be executed when running `ng update`. This is because multiple version updates is not allowed for `@angular/` packages. Ie: projects cannot update from v13 to version v15. Thus, the version 15 binary can only execute the update schematic to update from version 14 to version 15, which makes the older migrations unused redundant to be included in the NPM binary.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: remove redundant migrations" (#25785)

Issues.Title: fix(material): update schematics to work with latest UpdateBuffer
Issues.Body:
With this change we replace the `insertRight` usage with the `insertLeft` to make the update schematic work with the latest changes in `@angular-devkit/schematics`. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/9b07b469b622e083a9915ed3c24e1d53d8abf38f

Prior to this change the `legacy-components-v15` migration levrage some amgibuites with the `insertRight` method.

In a nutshell, `insertLeft` is append to the right of the string before it, while `insertRight` is prepend to the left of the string after it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material): update schematics to work with latest UpdateBuffer" (#25781)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-icon): material icons are linked just by fonticon attribute
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Using material v 14.2.0

Material icons are bound just by attribute `fonticon` which is not created on element when the `mat-icon` directive uses binding in a template by `[fontIcon]='someIconInComponentClass'`

Next - the class for the icon is no more added (was added in version 13)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

`<mat-icon aria-hidden="false" aria-label="Example home icon" [fontIcon]="icon"></mat-icon>`

```
import { Component } from '@angular/core';

/**
 * @title Basic icons
 */
@Component({
  selector: 'icon-overview-example',
  templateUrl: 'icon-overview-example.html',
})
export class IconOverviewExample {
  icon = 'ac_unit';
}
```

### Expected Behavior

working binding of icons (changing in a runtime)

class with icon should be added too

### Actual Behavior

material icons cannot be used with binding

class with icon is not added

### Environment

- Angular: 14.2.0
- CDK/Material: 14.2.0
- Browser(s): chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): win 10 64b

Issues.Title: bug(Expansion Panel): Lazy rendered panels don't work with ng-content
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using a wrapper component for `mat-expansion-panel` children, using `matExpansionPanelContent` does not seem to work as expected.

I created two components in my example:
- `app-expansion-wrapper`: This contains a `mat-expansion-panel` which renders its child components through `ng-content`. The `ng-content` is wrapped in a `<ng-template matExpansionPanelContent>`
- `app-expansion-child`: This component is to be lazily rendered.__

### Reproduction

Stackblitz example: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-szbmmv?file=src/app/expansion-overview-example.html

### Expected Behavior

I would expect the `ngOnInit` from child components not to run until the panel is opened.

### Actual Behavior

The `ngOnInit` from the content wrapped in `matExpansionPanelContent` runs on page load. The component to be lazily loaded logs to the console immediately.

### Environment

- Angular: 14.0.0
- CDK/Material: 14.2.3
- Browser(s): Tested in FF and Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Expansion Panel): Lazy rendered panels don't work with ng-content" (#25762)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(theming): inconsistent use of blue-grey Sass variable
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

There seems to be a mismatch between the name of a color palette in sections https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#using-a-pre-built-theme and https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#multiple-themes-in-one-file. In the first section, the name `bluegrey` is used in the table (third row, last column). In the second section, the name `blue-grey` is used (as a Sass variable `$blue-grey-palette`). The latter part is a code example, showing the correct variable name.

When looking up the available variables names in the table, using `$bluegrey-palette` would cause an error. This should therefore be changed to the correct `blue-grey` name.

### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/guide/theming
